intro: Ranunculus neapolitanus var. adpressepilosus, commonly known as the Naples buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Italy. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with a dark central blotch and deeply lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and thrives in woodland or meadow environments. It is a perennial species with a compact growth habit, reaching heights of about 20 to 30 centimeters. Its botanical features make it a notable ornamental plant in horticulture.
